title: High-Skill AI Wage Premium by 2030
description: Projected change in wages for workers with strong AI/ML skills relative to the median, measuring the emerging 'AI premium' in compensation.

sources.title: AI Job Postings and Salary Trends
The Impact of AI on Labor Markets: A Survey
sources.excerpt: Workers who complement AI see significant wage gains; those whose tasks are substituted face wage pressure.

sources.title: The AI Talent Landscape: Skills, Demand, and Compensation
Microsoft FY2024 Q3 Earnings — AI Talent Investment
sources.excerpt: Significant investment in AI talent, with compensation packages reflecting market premium for AI expertise.

sources.title: AI engineers command premium salaries as demand outstrips supply
The AI Wage Premium: Evidence from Online Job Postings
sources.excerpt: Job postings requiring AI skills offer 21-35% higher wages than comparable postings without AI requirements.

sources.title: AI engineer salaries are insane right now
NVIDIA 2024 10-K — AI Talent Compensation & Headcount Growth
sources.excerpt: NVIDIA disclosed median employee compensation of $328,000, up 24% YoY. Headcount in AI research grew 40% while total headcount grew 12%.

sources.title: OpenAI 8-K Equivalent — Compensation Benchmarks in Funding Docs
sources.excerpt: OpenAI's $6.6B raise implied avg AI researcher comp of $800K-$1.5M total. Senior ML engineers offered $400K-$900K base + equity.

sources.title: AI Skills Premium in Job Postings — LinkedIn Economic Graph
sources.excerpt: Job postings requiring AI/ML skills offer 28% higher salaries on average. Postings mentioning 'AI' in title or requirements grew 65% YoY.

sources.title: PwC AI Jobs Barometer 2025: The AI Wage Premium
sources.excerpt: Workers with AI skills now command a 56% wage premium over non-AI peers, up from 25% just one year prior. AI roles median compensation reaches $157K.

sources.title: AI Salary Statistics 2026: Global Compensation Trends
sources.excerpt: AI/ML engineers median total compensation reached $185K in 2025, with top-tier researchers commanding $500K-$1M+. The premium over general software roles widened to 35%.
